logic

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Server managing a directory of shared file names. Connections with clients are made through sockets, and each new connection creates a new Handler instance. The file names are stored in a table (using Java DB), and registered users are stored in a separate one. An instance of ClientFailureDetector is created along when initializing the server, allowing it to detect and handle crashes. The protocol used for socket communications is detailed in the Client class.
    See Also:
    Handler, ClientFailureDetector, Client

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) ClientFailureDetector clientFailureDetector
      The ClientFailureDetector instance used to detect and handle client crashes
      (package private) java.sql.Connection connection
      The connection to the database (when using Java DB)
      static java.lang.String DATASOURCE
      The default name of the database
      (package private) int host
      The port number the Server is using for socket communications, 10000 by default
      (package private) java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket
      The socket used for server-side socket communications
      static java.lang.String TABLE_NAME
      The default name of the table that contains information about files

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server(int host)
      Instantiate and start a ClientFailureDetector, creates the connection to the database.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.sql.Connection createDatasource()
      Assuming the connexion to the datasource has already been established, this method deletes everything in the database and create empty tables with the right columns, thus avoiding outdated data.
      private java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Creates the connection to the datasource (under JDBC Derby), and creates the database if it is not already existing
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main function.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
